page.title: 17MARCHMONT & POLWARTH.
page.content: MARCHMONT WAS BUILT IN 1750-1754 WITH THOMAS GIBSON AS ARCHITECT, NOT THE FAMOUS ADAM FAMILY AS HAS COMMONLY BEEN BELIEVED. IT IS NOT KNOWN WHO WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE REMARKABLE PLASTERWORK, POSSIBLY DUTCH OR ITALIAN CRAFTSMEN. THE HOUSE WAS ALTERED IN THE SECOND DECADE OF THIS CENTURY UNDER THE HANDS OF SIR ROBERT LORIMER WHO WAS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE THISTLE CHAPEL IN EDINBURGH CASTLE & HE MUCH ENLARGED IT. IT IS NOW BECOMING A SUE RYDER HOME FOR SICK & DISABLED, HOUSING ABOUT 40 RESIDENTS. IT CONTAINS A FINE MUSIC ROOM & ORGAN WHICH ARE IN DEMAND FOR CONCERTS; A SMALL ROMAN CATHOLIC CHAPEL DEDICATED TO ST. JOAN OF ARC WHICH WAS OPENED IN 1936 & HAS BEEN IN CONSTANT USE EVER SINCE, WEEKLY MASS BEING SAID BY THE LOCAL PRIEST FROM DUNS.
